cyclone.name: ELSA
cyclone.current_location: about 475 mi ESE of Isla Beata, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: racing WNW through the eastern-central Caribbean, then expected to slow, turn NW, cross Cuba, and move northward just west of the Florida peninsula toward the southeastern United States

port.name: Port of Palm Beach District, FL

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida peninsula, especially the Gulf side, but the east coast (including Palm Beach) lies within the 5-day cone
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts are possible late Tuesday into Wednesday with peak probability of 20%
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant surge expected on the Atlantic side; greatest surge threat will be on Florida’s Gulf coast
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands could drop 2–4 in., locally 4–6 in., producing short-term flooding in poor-drainage areas
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible in outer rain bands as the system crosses the peninsula
